text:
01 of 15 FRIENDS FOREVER Reisig Taylor/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Courteney Cox and Jennifer Aniston's friendship kicked off in the '90s when they worked on Friends, which saw the actresses take on polar opposite, yet equally lovable, roles.

02 of 15 BACK IN BLACK Jim Smeal/WireImage Proof Aniston and Cox were meant to be BFFs: "They wanted Court to play Rachel [Green]. Unbeknownst to each other, I wanted to play Rachel and she wanted to play Monica [Geller]," the Cake star told Collider in 2015. "It worked out perfectly."

03 of 15 KEEPING IT CHILL Mirek Towski/DMI/The LIFE Picture Collection/Getty "[Courteney] is really normal," Ed Sheeran said of the actress-director. "She's from Alabama, so it's bred into her, but everyone she surrounds herself with is the same." He continued: "Jennifer Aniston's just as friendly. I'd only ever experienced the darker side of Hollywood and they give you faith in everything."

04 of 15 ALL LOVE Jim Smeal/WireImage "There's absolutely no judgment in Court," Aniston told More of her friend in 2014. "You'll never feel scolded. She's extremely fair, ridiculously loyal and fiercely loving."

05 of 15 HAT'S OFF Ke.Mazur/WireImage Wearing matching sunglasses, the stars share an embrace during at an outdoor event.

06 of 15 DOING GOOD Ron Galella, Ltd./WireImage Aniston and Cox took their friendship off-screen at the 8th Annual Fire & Ice Ball, which benefitted the Revlon/UCLA Women's Cancer Research Program, in 1997.

07 of 15 A STRONG CONNECTION Jeff Vespa/WireImage They've always been each other's shoulder to lean on. "It's funny, a lot of really close friends are kind of going through this right now or like Jennifer [who] has gone through it," Cox told Access Hollywood of her separation from ex-husband David Arquette. "I don't know what's going on in the planets or what, but things are being shaken up and I don't know what's going to happen, but, yeah, Jennifer has been amazing for sure."

08 of 15 FUN TIMES KMazur/WireImage "We just have fun, we laugh, we're inseparable and it's great," Cox told TV Week of the pair's dynamic.

09 of 15 LOOKING UP J. Vespa/WireImage The longstanding best friends had a moment at the 6th Annual Platinum Circle Awards in 2006.

10 of 15 WHAT AN HONOR FOX/WireImage "The last guest to leave was Courteney," an observer told PEOPLE of Aniston's maid of honor at the actress's 2015 wedding to Justin Theroux. "She left right after Ellen DeGeneres and Jimmy Kimmel. She left around 3 a.m."

11 of 15 ACTING OUT Karen Neal/ABC via Getty Since the Friends series finale in 2004, Aniston has shown support for her famous BFF by guest starring on Cox's shows, including Dirt and Cougar Town.

12 of 15 HOLDING ON TIGHT Michael Caulfield/WireImage "I've slept in her guest bedroom a lot," Aniston admitted in a 2014 More interview. "Without giving away too much of my private stuff, all I can say is she's been there for me through thick and thin."

13 of 15 TWINNING MOMENT Lester Cohen/WireImage "She's the greatest BFF," Coxsaid about Aniston in an interview with Yahoo in 2015.

14 of 15 HAPPY TO BE HERE Angela Weiss/Getty They'll always be there for one another — especially when it comes to showing various projects some love. Aniston gave Cox's directorial debut, Just Before I Go, an enthusiastic two thumbs up at a 2015 screening.
authors: Grace Gavilanes Is A Former Associate Editor At People. She Left People In
title: Jennifer Aniston and Courteney Cox: Best Friend Photos

meta_data.description: We're taking a look back at the pair's sweet longstanding friendship
